publicwhip.spmotion: * S2M-2385 Brian Adam:Commonwealth Local Government Conference 2005, Aberdeen—That the Parliament congratulates the city of Aberdeen on its successful bid to host the Commonwealth Local Government Conference from 15 to 17 March 2005 and hopes that this prestigious gathering, which will attract a number of heads of state and world statesmen, will enhance Aberdeen and Scotland’s position on the world stage.
S2M-2385 Commonwealth Local Government Conference 2005, Aberdeen (lodged on 7 February 2005) Michael Matheson*, Donald Gorrie*

S2M-2385 Commonwealth Local Government Conference 2005, Aberdeen (lodged on 7 February 2005) Mike Pringle*, Stewart Stevenson*, Jim Mather*, Robin Harper*, Mr Jamie Stone*, Robert Brown*, Rob Gibson*, Mr Adam Ingram*, Fergus Ewing*, Eleanor Scott*, Mr David Davidson*, Des McNulty*, Karen Gillon*, Richard Lochhead*, Tricia Marwick*, Ms Sandra White*
S2M-2385 Commonwealth Local Government Conference 2005, Aberdeen (lodged on 7 February 2005) Dr Jean Turner*, Mrs Nanette Milne*, Nora Radcliffe*, Alex Johnstone*, Mrs Margaret Ewing*

S2M-2385 Brian Adam:Commonwealth Local Government Conference 2005, Aberdeen—That the Parliament congratulates the city of Aberdeen on its successful bid to host the Commonwealth Local Government Conference from 15 to 17 March 2005 and hopes that this prestigious gathering, which will attract a number of heads of state and world statesmen, will enhance Aberdeen and Scotland’s position on the world stage. Supported by: Michael Matheson, Donald Gorrie, Mike Pringle, Stewart Stevenson, Jim Mather, Robin Harper, Mr Jamie Stone, Robert Brown, Rob Gibson, Mr Adam Ingram, Fergus Ewing, Eleanor Scott, Mr David Davidson, Des McNulty, Karen Gillon, Richard Lochhead, Tricia Marwick, Ms Sandra White, Dr Jean Turner, Mrs Nanette Milne, Nora Radcliffe, Alex Johnstone, Mrs Margaret Ewing, Maureen Macmillan*
S2M-2385 Commonwealth Local Government Conference 2005, Aberdeen (lodged on 7 February 2005) Fiona Hyslop*
